titleStmt.title: The Kings Majesties last message and declaration to His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax. Communicating I. His Maj. desires touching his subjects of England. 2. His Maj. firme resolution, touching the priviledge of His Subjects. 3. His Maj. gracious promise to his Excellency. Written by His Maj. own hand, and signed Charles Rex, now resident in the Isle of Wight. Whereunto is annexed, the gen. resolution and answer, concerning His Maj. desires; presented to the publike view of the Kingdome. Imprimatur G. Mabbot.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

titleStmt.title: The Kings Majesties last message and declaration to His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax. Communicating I. His Maj. desires touching his subjects of England. 2. His Maj. firme resolution, touching the priviledge of His Subjects. 3. His Maj. gracious promise to his Excellency. Written by His Maj. own hand, and signed Charles Rex, now resident in the Isle of Wight. Whereunto is annexed, the gen. resolution and answer, concerning His Maj. desires; presented to the publike view of the Kingdome. Imprimatur G. Mabbot.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for G. Horton,

notesStmt.note: In fact two letters, one signed on p.2: Charles Rex, another signed on p.6: T.F. (i.e. Thomas Fairfax).
Portrait of Charles I and Fairfax on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
